meanings.def: a small computer that is easy to carry, with a large touch screen and usually without a physical keyboard
examples: The company has launched its latest 10-inch tablet.
Consumers show a growing preference for tablets and smartphones over PCs and laptops.

meanings.def: a small round solid piece of medicine that you swallow
examples: Take two tablets with water before meals.
I took the tablets prescribed by my doctor.
The drug is now available in tablet and capsule form.

meanings.def: an amount of a substance in a small, round, solid piece
a flat piece of stone that has words written on it, especially one that has been fixed to a wall in memory of an important person or event
examples: The school has a memorial tablet engraved with the name of the founder.
(figurative) We can be very flexible—our entry requirements are not set in tablets of stone (= they can be changed).

meanings.def: a number of pieces of paper for writing or drawing on, that are fastened together at one edge
